verses.text_plain: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,
verses.verse_html:
1Moreover Job continued his parable, and said, ▼
▼ continued: Heb. added to take up

footnotes.body_text: ▼ continued: Heb. added to take up
footnotes.body_html: ▼ continued: Heb. added to take up

verses.text_plain: As God liveth, who hath taken away my judgment; and the Almighty, who hath vexed my soul;
verses.verse_html:
2As God liveth, who hath taken away my judgment; and the Almighty, who hath vexed my soul; ▼
▼ vexed…: Heb. made my soul bitter

footnotes.body_text: ▼ vexed…: Heb. made my soul bitter
footnotes.body_html: ▼ vexed…: Heb. made my soul bitter

verses.text_plain: All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils;
verses.verse_html:
3All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils; ▼
▼ the spirit…: that is, the breath which God gave him

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the spirit…: that is, the breath which God gave him
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the spirit…: that is, the breath which God gave him

verses.text_plain: My lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.
verses.verse_html: 4My lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.

verses.text_plain: God forbid that I should justify you: till I die I will not remove mine integrity from me.
verses.verse_html: 5God forbid that I should justify you: till I die I will not remove mine integrity from me.

verses.text_plain: My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go: my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.
verses.verse_html:
6My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go: my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live. ▼
▼ so long…: Heb. from my days

tokens.text: fast, and will not let it go

footnotes.body_text: ▼ so long…: Heb. from my days
footnotes.body_html: ▼ so long…: Heb. from my days

verses.text_plain: Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.
verses.verse_html: 7Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.

verses.text_plain: For what is the hope of the hypocrite, though he hath gained, when God taketh away his soul?
verses.verse_html: 8For what is the hope of the hypocrite, though he hath gained, when God taketh away his soul?

verses.text_plain: Will God hear his cry when trouble cometh upon him?
verses.verse_html: 9Will God hear his cry when trouble cometh upon him?

verses.text_plain: Will he delight himself in the Almighty? will he always call upon God?
verses.verse_html: 10Will he delight himself in the Almighty? will he always call upon God?

verses.text_plain: I will teach you by the hand of God: that which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.
verses.verse_html:
11I will teach you by the hand of God: that which is with the Almighty will I not conceal. ▼
▼ by…: or, being in the hand, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ by…: or, being in the hand, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ by…: or, being in the hand, etc

verses.text_plain: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye thus altogether vain?
verses.verse_html: 12Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye thus altogether vain?

tokens.text: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen
why then are ye thus altogether

verses.text_plain: This is the portion of a wicked man with God, and the heritage of oppressors, which they shall receive of the Almighty.
verses.verse_html: 13This is the portion of a wicked man with God, and the heritage of oppressors, which they shall receive of the Almighty.

verses.text_plain: If his children be multiplied, it is for the sword: and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.
verses.verse_html: 14If his children be multiplied, it is for the sword: and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.

verses.text_plain: Those that remain of him shall be buried in death: and his widows shall not weep.
verses.verse_html: 15Those that remain of him shall be buried in death: and his widows shall not weep.

verses.text_plain: Though he heap up silver as the dust, and prepare raiment as the clay;
verses.verse_html: 16Though he heap up silver as the dust, and prepare raiment as the clay;

verses.text_plain: He may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.
verses.verse_html: 17He may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.

verses.text_plain: He buildeth his house as a moth, and as a booth that the keeper maketh.
verses.verse_html: 18He buildeth his house as a moth, and as a booth that the keeper maketh.

verses.text_plain: The rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered: he openeth his eyes, and he is not.
verses.verse_html: 19The rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered: he openeth his eyes, and he is not.

tokens.text: but he shall not be gathered

verses.text_plain: Terrors take hold on him as waters, a tempest stealeth him away in the night.
verses.verse_html: 20Terrors take hold on him as waters, a tempest stealeth him away in the night.

verses.text_plain: The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth: and as a storm hurleth him out of his place.
verses.verse_html: 21The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth: and as a storm hurleth him out of his place.

verses.text_plain: For God shall cast upon him, and not spare: he would fain flee out of his hand.
verses.verse_html:
22For God shall cast upon him, and not spare: he would fain flee out of his hand. ▼
▼ he…: Heb. in fleeing he would flee

footnotes.body_text: ▼ he…: Heb. in fleeing he would flee
footnotes.body_html: ▼ he…: Heb. in fleeing he would flee

verses.text_plain: Men shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.
verses.verse_html: 23Men shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.
